FuncDef:
The forward-alarm slot service channel bandwidth usage-rate alarm on off command sets the alarm reporting and alarm clearance thresholds for value-added services.
The undo forward-alarm slot service channel usage-rate alarm command restores the alarm reporting and alarm clearance thresholds for value-added services.
By default, the alarm threshold is 80, and the clear alarm threshold is 75.
CLIs: forward-alarm slot <slot-id> service channel bandwidth usage-rate alarm on <onRate> off <offRate>
undo forward-alarm slot <slot-id> service channel alarm

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm reporting threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 100.

Specifies the alarm clearance threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 99.

Specifies the slot ID of a board. The value range varies according to device hardware.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] forward-alarm slot 1 service channel bandwidth usage-rate alarm on 90 off 80
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the alarm reporting and alarm clearance thresholds for value-added services, run the forward-alarm slot service channel bandwidth usage-rate alarm command. To restore the alarm reporting and alarm clearance thresholds for value-added services, run the undo forward-alarm slot service channel usage-rate alarm command.
